intro: Rytigynia umbellulata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, red, berry-like fruits that are edible but have a peppery taste. Rytigynia umbellulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some historical use in traditional medicine.
